subSections.title: Readings
Usage notes
subSections.text: * Both {{ja-l|潮}} and {{ja-l|汐}} have the ''kun''-readings of ''shio'' and ''ushio''. Archaically, tides in the morning were called {{m|ja|朝潮|tr=asashio}}, the term for tides at nighttime was {{m|ja|夕汐|tr=yūshio}}. For tides at any time of day, {{m|ja|潮汐|tr=chōseki}} may be used.
